categories.title: AI Agent Platform and News Aggregation Updates

content.text: [dtb0x] introduced *aigent.sh*, a platform powered by *ElizaOS* to make AI agents accessible to non-technical users. They are rolling out daily updates and seeking feedback. [odilitime] inquired about submission to the registry but did not receive a response.

[dankvr] is developing an AI-powered news aggregator to summarize discussions from multiple channels: `general`, `plug-your-projects`, `agent-dev-school`, and `pull-requests`. They provided channel IDs for implementation.
[flaneurofmetaverses] asked for an update on a plugin issue but did not receive a response.
[fforbeck] requested a review for a pull request but did not receive a response.

Eliza v2 is still in beta and not stable for production. Some users are testing it for hobby projects, but installation issues have been reported, particularly with `npx @elizaos/cli create` and `bun install`. Solutions include ensuring Bun is installed and using `npm create eliza@beta` instead.
Database migration errors have been encountered due to schema changes in `pglite`. The recommended solution is to wipe the old `pglite` database and restart.
Users have struggled with porting plugins to v2. It is recommended to wait for a stable release and updated documentation before proceeding.
Deepseek-r1:14b is preferred for instruction-following tasks despite its slower speed.
Users are encouraged to log issues with the 'V2' label for better tracking.
Dynamic plugins are currently not working as expected. The 'getting started' steps need verification and updates.
Default agents (Eliza, Eddy, etc.) are not appearing as expected. A fix is planned in the next few days.
The Twitter client currently uses user/password authentication instead of API keys, leading to account bans. A change to API key authentication has been requested.
The chunk size in the knowledge table is too small, causing excessive row returns. A suggested fix is to increase the chunk size.
A new platform, *aigent.sh*, was introduced to make AI agents accessible to non-technical users, powered by *ElizaOS*. Daily updates are being rolled out, and feedback is being sought.
Users have reported issues with the CoinGecko plugin, but no details or solutions were provided.
An 'out of memory' error was diagnosed, and users were asked about available RAM, but no resolution was reached.
A `better-sqlite3` error was encountered when running `pnpm start` for a Twitter agent. No solution was provided.

An AI-powered news aggregator is being set up to summarize discussions from multiple channels, including `general`, `plug-your-projects`, `agent-dev-school`, and `pull-requests`. Channel IDs have been provided for implementation.
A request was made for a plugin update, but no response was recorded.
A pull request review was requested but did not receive a response.
